summary:
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
 
Recalling previous resolutions on Iraq, reaffirms Iraq's independence, sovereignty, unity, and territorial integrity.

Supports Iraq's stabilization efforts, including fighting terrorism and addressing the needs of all Iraqis.

Welcomes the Government of Iraq's efforts to deliver reforms, hold free and fair elections, and requests UN assistance.

Calls on the international community to support Iraq's humanitarian, stabilization, reconstruction, and development efforts.

Decides to:
 
1. Extend the mandate of UNAMI until 31 May 2021.

2. Authorize the Special Representative of the Secretary-General and UNAMI to:
 
(a) Advise on inclusive political dialogue and national reconciliation.

(b) Assist with:
 
(i) Free and fair elections and referenda.

(ii) Constitutional review and implementation.

(iii) Security sector reform.

(iv) Regional dialogue and cooperation.

(c) Promote:
 
(i) Humanitarian assistance and refugee return.

(ii) Essential civil and social services.

(iii) Economic reform and sustainable development.

(iv) UN agencies' contributions to objectives.

(d) Promote accountability, human rights, and judicial reform.
The Security Council:

1. Extends the mandate of the United Nations Assistance Mission for Iraq (UNAMI) until 31 May 2021;

2. Requests UNAMI to:
    (e) approach gender mainstreaming as a cross-cutting issue throughout its mandate and advise and assist the Government of Iraq to ensure the full, equal and meaningful participation of women;

    (f) assist the Government of Iraq and the UN Country Team in strengthening child protection, including rehabilitation and reintegration of children;

3. Recognizes the essential security of UN personnel and calls upon the Government of Iraq to continue providing security and logistical support;

4. Intends to review UNAMI's mandate and reporting cycle by 31 May 2021 or sooner if requested by the Government of Iraq;

5. Requests the Secretary-General to report every three months on progress made towards fulfilling UNAMI's responsibilities;

6. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
